9.text: We're going to have a look at the 'turn in the road'

11.text: or as it used to be called a 'three point turn'.

15.text: This is peoples preferable manoeuvre to carry out on the driving test.

19.text: The object of this manoeuvre is turn the car around. Normally in three turns

24.text: using forward and reverse gears. Also remembering to observe for other road users

34.text: When starting this manoeuvre make sure that you start in a safe, convenient

37.text: and legal place. You certainly don't want to do this on a busy road

41.text: where there is other people about.

43.text: In this first part of the video I will be occasionally pausing it to highlight certain points of this manoeuvre .

51.text: First thing to consider will be the camber of the road.

55.text: It doesn't look much but it will affect us during this manoeuvre.

60.text: We first need to prepare the car.

62.text: So it will be clutch down, into first gear and then we get the gas and biting point.

67.text: It's important to get the biting point here as we'll be going over the camber up hill slightly.

72.text: Now we check all around, mirrors, blind spot.

75.text: We won't need to signal or other road users will think that we're driving off.

79.text: Then as soon as you release the handbrake

82.text: we will steer full lock, maximum to the right.

85.text: make sure that the car moves when you do this

88.text: or otherwise it's called dry steering and it wears out your tyres

90.text: As you steer round to the right, I can't emphasise enough how much that you have to look around...

99.text: looking out especially for pedestrians and cyclists.

100.text: Now as you get half way across the road

102.text: the camber of the road will go down hill slightly

104.text: so be prepared to lower the clutch down and brake a little.

109.text: it's good to steer a little to the left

111.text: as this helps for the reversing part.

115.text: we then put the handbrake on and put it into reverse gear

118.text: But how do we know when to stop

123.text: like it goes under the right-hand door mirror.

125.text: Before you reverse, make sure that you observe around.

129.text: Make sure that you check the back window as well

136.text: make sure that you wait, see what they're going to do

139.text: if they do leave you enough space to finish then

141.text: maybe it will be safe for you to carry on.

144.text: Because we are reversing up a camber

147.text: it's important to make sure that we get the gas and the biting point.

149.text: Also bear in mind that reverse gear is very powerful.

152.text: Be careful not to go too fast on this bit.

155.text: As soon as you move back, make sure that you steer

157.text: full lock to the left, steering quickly but driving slowly.

160.text: You're then going to go down hill the other side because of the camber

163.text: clutch down and brake a bit.

166.text: As you reverse, make sure that you're checking all around.

170.text: Check over your left shoulder and right shoulder.

172.text: Be prepared to steer a little to the right before you stop

176.text: as this can help for the final forward part.

178.text: We then put the handbrake on and then into first gear.

180.text: Now this is your reference point so that you know when to stop.

183.text: Over your right hand shoulder you'll see

185.text: that the kerb disappears into your right hand door pillar.

193.text: and then steer back round to the right

195.text: again, a bit of a hill start there because of the camber.

197.text: We will then stop on the left in a safe and convenient place.

201.text: That's how you do a turn in the road.

203.text: Now lets have a look at it again without all the pausing.

213.text: It's important when you do this manoeuvre to take your time.

220.text: Make sure that you observe left and right looking out for other road users

223.text: Get confident with your reference points.

230.text: When you reverse, again make sure that you're checking around.

231.text: Especially observe over your left shoulder.

236.text: Don't let other cars panic you

238.text: if they do arrive, they can see that you're learning.

247.text: That's how you do a turn in the road
